config.question: How did Kissinger help to bring about the end of the Arab oil embargo?

choices.content: He organized trade sanctions against Arab countries.
He negotiated an end to the Iranian Revolution.
He persuaded the Israelis to pull back from the Sinai Peninsula.
He contributed to the American victory in Cambodia.

answer_2.response: Consider This: The oil embargo served to highlight the fact that the United States was dependent on other countries, most notably in the Persian Gulf, for its economic well-being. After the Arab embargo began, OPEC, led by the shah of Iran, raised crude oil prices fourfold. In the United States, gasoline prices at the pumps nearly doubled. Diplomatic intervention in the matter grew increasingly important. See L.O. 31.2 Oil and Inflation.
